are you at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToSetupSoundCards
about 1/4 of the way down, it lists sb16 as an example
add      snd-sb16   on a line by itself at the bottom
ok, ctl-X to exit, and save it
just let it keep the old one. There was other stuff in that file you opened, right?
after you save it, type     cat /etc/modules    and verify it's ok
that will be an empty, new file
ok, now hightlight the line in the instructions that starts with options snd-sb16 , move the mouse to the terminal window and press the middle button
that web page I gave you
close and save, cat /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-sb16 to verify again
ok, now    sudo modprobe snd-sb16   ; there should be no output at all
now type     alsamixer     and run up the volumes to about 70%
ok, play some music
to exit, hit escape.  Also, be sure you raised master/main and pcm
